ygData.subject: RE: Frustration Story (OT - Long)
ygData.msgSnippet: Those are good questions often brought up here Claudio.  Normally I agree that binding is fairly easy to acquire, but that is not always the case.  If you have
ygData.messageBody:
Those are good questions often brought up here Claudio. Normally I agree
that binding is fairly easy to acquire, but that is not always the case. If
you have ever ventured to Erudin you you will understand my meaning. I have
been to Erudin three times now and all three times there were less than 6
people on the entire continent, none of whom could bind. I had Erudin all
to myself and Kerra Isle as well. It was very depressing.

Also worry not about the English, it sounded better than that spoken by many
who call it their first language! What is your first language by the way?

Kitasi of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: claudio gante [mailto:gante@...]
Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 11:15 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Frustration Story (OT - Long)


From: "claudio gante" <gante@...>

>The difference between my story and yours? I was bound in Kelethin, and
>heading for Erudin. Death #1 = the exact same place you died, but Death #2
>was in Kithicor (thanks, Capt. Shralok!). That's when I decided to ask for
>a teleport.

That makes me ask something that was in my mind for some time now.
Why we bards, Traveleurs of Norrah, that should move from city to city,
telling our stories..
Why we don't have any binding song?? I particulary think it would
make sense,
Even if not bind forever, it could have binded a few days, instead i
have to buy, "or beg to buy" someone else bind !!!

[]'s Kel.

PS.: Sorry for the poor english..
